**Frame‐by‐Frame Analysis**

1. **Frame 1**  
   – The ego‐vehicle is on a paved portion bounded on the right by a concrete construction barrier.  
   – To the left of the ego‐vehicle’s lane there is clearly another lane where at least one vehicle (a white pickup) is moving in the same direction. The center markings suggest a division between two lanes heading the same way.  
   – Beyond the far left (grassy median and cones) appears to be either a turning lane or opposing traffic; however, that area is obviously separated from ego’s two-lane roadway.

2. **Frame 2**  
   – The black SUV traveling just left of the ego‐vehicle confirms the presence of a second forward lane.  
   – The construction barrier on the right remains in place, ruling out a third lane on that side.

3. **Frame 3**  
   – The black SUV continues straight ahead in what is clearly a separate left lane.  
   – No additional lane markings appear on the right; the barrier still ends any possibility of more than two lanes in ego’s direction.

4. **Frame 4**  
   – The view downrange still shows only two lanes traveling forward: the lane with the black sedan ahead of ego and the lane occupied by the SUV to its left.

5. **Frame 5**  
   – The roadway narrows at the construction zone on the right, with no evidence of a third lane.  
   – Lane markings continue to confirm two forward lanes even as the intersection approaches.

**Contextual Reasoning**  
Despite the downtown/construction setting, the pavement markings and congruent vehicle positions across all frames confirm only two lanes in the ego‐vehicle’s direction. The concrete barrier on the right removes any possibility of a third through‐lane, and the grassy or coned area on the far left is not open to through traffic.

**Match to Answer Choices**  
• A (1 lane) is inconsistent with the clear second lane to the left.  
• C (3 lanes) and D (4 lanes) do not match the visual evidence; there is no third or fourth lane open in the frames.  
• B (2 lanes) aligns with what is visible in all frames.

<answer>B</answer>
